hints.content:
We can think of subtraction as:

$\maroonD{\text{total}} - \blueE{\text{part}} = \goldE{\text{ part}}$

We can also think of subtraction as:

$\maroonD{\text{total}} - \goldE{\text{ part}} =  \blueE{\text{part}}$

So, we can subtract $\goldE{18}$ from $\maroonD{62}$ to find the missing $\blueE{\text{part}}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/921b9bc2b646507e2e688cea6c9259171bb6130c)

question.content:
**What number makes this equation true?**
